details.story:

Grown high in Huila, Cauca, NariÃ±o, and Tolima, itâ€™s tended by small-scale farmers who still handpick ripe cherries one by one. They wash and rest the coffee for a day or soâ€”26 to 36 quiet hoursâ€”before drying. Itâ€™s careful, patient work. The result is coffee with a gentle brightness and calm sweetness.

Then, thereâ€™s ASDECAFE from Guatemala.
A younger collectiveâ€”more than 1,000 growersâ€”spread across Huehuetenango and El QuichÃ©. By joining forces, they share the cost of moving coffee down the mountain and up through certification. Together, they can earn more, learn more, and grow better.

We bring these two coffees togetherâ€”Colombiaâ€™s steady, hands-on tradition and Guatemalaâ€™s shared strengthâ€”to land in a sweet, balanced cup.

characteristics.Altitude: High-elevation smallholder plots â€” among the highest in Ethiopia
characteristics.Flavor Notes: Perfumed berries, raspberry candy, strawberry-lavender, citrus pop, and a syrupy tropical finish

details.story:
This lot comes from smallholders in Chelchele, part of Ethiopiaâ€™s Gedeb districtâ€”an area revered for its explosive naturals and aromatic intensity. Gedeb borders Guji, and its profiles stretch beyond classic Yirgacheffe: expect high-elevation clarity, fruit-forward sparkle, and a perfume-like lift unique to this corner of Gedeo.

The coffee was processed by EDN Ethiopian Coffee at their Chelchele site, where more than 200 seasonal workers rotate cherry, sort meticulously, and manage the long natural-drying cycle. EDN prefinances farmers and supports staff with meals, lodging, and educationâ€”an approach that builds loyalty and stability in a highly competitive region.

For this microlot, ripe cherry is sorted, floated, and sealed in carbon-fiber drums for 7â€“10 days of cool anaerobic fermentation. The slow, oxygen-free environment deepens fruit sugars without tipping into over-fermentation. Post-ferment, the syrupy cherry mass dries gradually on raised beds before resting in cool storage to stabilize sweetness and extend longevity.

The result is a vibrant, fruit-saturated cup with berry perfume, candy-like acidity, and a soft, syrupy finish.

Brew a touch finer to catch the full glow.

Sip slow.
